meanings.definition: The act of waving or fluttering
meanings.sent1: The wafture of the flag caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed watching the wafture of the leaves in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The wafture of the magician's wand made the audience gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The wafture of her hand seemed to paint invisible patterns in the air.
meanings.sent5: The wafture of the butterfly's wings was delicate and mesmerizing.

meanings.sent1: Her wafture towards the door signaled her desire to leave.
meanings.sent2: He greeted us with a friendly wafture of his hand.
meanings.sent3: The cat's wafture of its tail indicated its contentment.
meanings.sent4: The wafture of the dancer's hand added grace to her performance.
meanings.sent5: The wafture of the wind through the trees was soothing and peaceful.

meanings.definition: The sound or motion of something being carried through the air
meanings.sent1: The wafture of the distant music reached our ears faintly.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the wafture of the airplane flying overhead.
meanings.sent3: The wafture of the paper airplane ended in a crash landing.
meanings.sent4: The wafture of the scent of flowers filled the room with fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The wafture of the kite soaring high in the sky was a sight to behold.
